Alaska is ground zero for climate change, but Senator Dan Sullivan called the Alaskans he was elected to represent “climate change alarmists.” He voted to say climate change isn't real, he's against the Paris Climate Treaty and he even wanted to let energy companies dump their waste on tribal lands. It's clear, Dan Sullivan doesn't understand what Alaskans are living with every day. We can win this, but we need your help. Chip in today. >> http://bit.ly/2UYfRmU

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate,Alaskans for Al
text: We're feeling a lot of #alaskalove today from the folks over at @AlaskansforAl. Thank you to all the working Alaskans out there who are volunteering their time to bring real change to the U.S. Senate. Please like/follow/share @AlaskansforAl to help get Dr. Al Gross elected... and submit a photo of your own! #ValentinesDay #AlwaysAlaskaHappy Valentine's Day from your Alaskans for Al organizers! Our names are Zach and Laura, and we're newlyweds and educators based in the tiny town of Gustavus, AK. We've struggled with health care costs, watched record high temps hammer our salmon, lived with the threat of toxic chemicals in our water... and been repeatedly ignored by our Washington delegation. So it's time for a change. We started this page because we believe Al Gross is going to bring that change. He's a real Alaskan, who understands the challenges we face in a bush community. Sending lots of Alaska love on this special day! ❤️ 5/268 Dr. Al Gross for US Senate, #AlaskaAl, #alaskansforal, #aksen, #akelect, #alaska, #alaskan, #alaskalife, #alaskaliving, #alaskalove, #alaskabornandraised, #nopebble, #grassroots, #hearourvoice, #independent, #getinvolved, #election2020, #ussenate, #vote, #iwillvote, #flipthesenate, #valentinesday, #valentines, #valentinesday2020, #love, #alaskalove, #newlyweds, #thepersonalispolitical

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Almost 60 years ago, Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. shared his dream of "a day when people will not be judged by the color of their skin, but by the content of their character." In the decades since, we have made great strides toward that dream but they have been accompanied with terrible divisiveness. As one of the most diverse states in the country, Alaska itself has experienced both the important steps forward and the urgent need for more progress. Dr. King also famously said that "the arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice." As your United States Senator, I will work tirelessly to continue to bend that moral arc toward Dr. King's dream — a dream we all share.

text: This is unacceptable.  Last week Dan Sullivan refused to stand up for Alaska and instead sided with Trump.  Then, Dan Sullivan said he was seeking answers. Well, here’s your answer Dan: At Eielsen Air Force Base in Alaska, a boiler failure at a facility that provides all electrical power and steam heat for the base is "imminent," the report says. With temperatures as low as 65 degrees below zero, a failure would be devastating to facilities and the missions housed by them within hours." The base would be forced to evacuate within hours and once closed "would freeze and require millions of dollars of repair to return to usable conditions." When I say Dan Sullivan doesn’t put Alaska first, I mean it.

This is not who we are or what we stand for as Alaskans.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: The Pebble Mine is a bad deal. I’m a commercial fishermen, so I know how 14,000 Alaskans depend on the fish in Bristol Bay to support their families. Dan Sullivan must have known Mike Dunleavy was working to overrule the EPA, whose scientists say the mine would cause a "complete loss of" the bay's fish habitat.  Sullivan chose to do nothing to stop it -- so he is going along with it.  It is inexcusable that our elected officials would ignore the concerns of regular people and deny clear scientific evidence that shows the Pebble Mine is a bad deal for Alaska.  I’ll always fight for Alaska.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: As a life-long Alaskan who's fished Alaska’s waters since I was a kid, I'm concerned by this news.  I urge Dan Sullivan to use his good relationship with President Trump and Governor Dunleavy to step in and stop this decision from being made in Washington D.C. I urge Dan Sullivan to insist that this decision be made here in Alaska with the input from Alaskans who fish these waters and live on this land and scientists at the EPA.  Dan Sullivan, Alaskans and science are being left behind in decisions like this. This must change. #AlwaysAlaska

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: "I endorse Dr. Al Gross in his bid to become the US Senator for Alaska. I fought for statehood and participated in writing Alaska's Constitution. I have known every US Senator who has represented Alaska. Today we need someone with the integrity of Bob Bartlett and the tenacity of Ted Stevens. We need a leader who has a broad vision for Alaska. Al Gross has all these qualities and more. He is Alaska born and raised. He is a doctor and a commercial fisherman. He is honest and not beholden to outside interests. I proudly endorse Dr. Al Gross and urge Alaskans to join me to elect Al to the US Senate." - Vic Fischer

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Great time here at Founders Day with Mayor Karl Cook.  I’m having an amazing time listening and learning from everyone I meet. A special day here in Metlakatla. #AlwaysAlaska

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Beautiful night here in Metlakatla.  We live in such a beautiful state. Let’s protect it. #AlwaysAlaska

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Making our way from Ketchikan to Metlakatla for Founders Day. Some fog delayed us, but finally we’re here! #AlwaysAlaska

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: On Saturday, the Anchorage Daily News highlighted the clear difference in priorities between Dan Sullivan and me as part of their "best and worst" of the week round-up.  While I went to Juneau to stand on a picket line with ferry workers who were demanding fair wages, benefits, and working conditions, Dan Sullivan played basketball with Ted Cruz -- an extreme politician from Texas who has called for legislation to cripple unions and workers' rights.  The choice in this election is clear. I’ll be a U.S. Senator who will always be about Alaska and fighting for working people. Dan Sullivan? He’ll pass on that.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: On my way to the Blueberry Festival in Ketchikan I stopped in Wrangell. It was a great opportunity to walk around town and share my vision for our state and let folks know about our campaign.  I met Calleigh Miller of Breakaway Adventures and talked with her about the Summer Tourism season and things we can do to help build Alaska’s economy and invite business and new jobs into our state. #AlwaysAlaska

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: I'm an Alaskan commercial fisherman. My mother, Shari, was the first Executive Director of the United Fishermen of Alaska. I know how important fishing and protecting our oceans and waterways are for our economy and for working people.   The Pebble Mine is a bad deal plain and simple. This land is owned by the people of Alaska, we should not sell out to a foreign company and special interests at the expense of our environment and everyday Alaskans.  What do you think? Take our poll today >>

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: I'm running for Senate to be a voice for Alaskan workers in Washington. That's why I'm honored to have Tom Cashen’s support. As the former Alaska Commissioner of Labor, Tom spent his career fighting to better the lives of working men and women across our state. Thanks for jumping on board with our campaign, Tom! “As commissioner of labor I got to see first hand why Alaska needs a Senator who is an unabashed friend of labor. While Dan Sullivan is silent on Davis-Bacon, project labor agreements, and defined benefit pension reform, I know Dr. Al Gross is going to be a strong voice for apprentice utilization, workforce development, and protecting our collective bargaining rights.” – Tom Cashen

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: I'm an orthopedic surgeon. I know how badly Alaska needs nurses and how we must do more to keep young people here. It angers me that our state's leaders have broken Alaska's promises to more than 2,500 students by defunding their Alaska Performance Scholarships.  Students like Sian Gonzales who want to go to college, become a nurse, and work in Alaska but now face being forced to leave the state, take on huge amounts of student debt, or give up their dreams.  Unlike Mike Dunleavy and Dan Sullivan, I'll be a different kind of leader - one who always puts Alaskans first, not the special interests. And I'll fight to make college affordable.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Just got to Juneau and went straight to join our brothers and sisters from the Inlandboatmen’s Union of the Pacific, who are standing up to Dunleavy and demanding a fair and just system.  Dan Sullivan, our ferry workers deserve a solution and our economy needs their services.  Where are you Dan Sullivan?

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Great conversations this morning at The Southeast Alaska State Fair in Haines! From health care costs to jobs, and from Climate Change to Alaskan Public Education, Democrats, Independents, and Republicans share similar concerns for our state.  We are excited to run a campaign that brings people together with a common purpose of solving critical problems facing Alaska. #AlwaysAlaska

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: I'm a life-long Alaskan. Until recently, I've never experienced a 90-degree day in Anchorage. I've witnessed the effects of climate change first-hand. I see it all the time out on the water. I've noticed how sockeye and king salmon are returning smaller than usual. Alaskan commercial fishing is valued at $1.8 billion and employs at least 29,000 Alaskans. Sport fishing generates another $250 million in charters and thousands of good-paying jobs. With so much of our economy at stake it's never mattered more to take on climate change.  Maybe Dan Sullivan doesn't see how climate change harms Alaska because he's not from here. But I see it. I'll be a U.S. Senator who takes on climate change to protect our environment and our sport and commercial fish industry.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Good morning from Haines! Excited to spend another day with voters talking about how to improve our Alaskan economy and create good paying jobs for our state. #AlwaysAlaska

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: "Throughout the years I spent working for Alaska's families, workers, elders and children, and clean government, I saw partisan legislators stop good laws because they put their party ahead of people. That’s wrong whether you do that in D.C. or Juneau. I'm supporting Dr. Al Gross for US Senate because I know he'll be the strong, independent fighter Alaskans need to help find common sense solutions that work for us. Al will put people’s interests over the powerful corporate campaign donors who are ruining our country."  -- former State Representative Les Gara

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: With a background in science, I know what a serious threat climate change is to the State of Alaska, where we are literally losing villages to the ocean.  But Dan Sullivan and Mitch McConnell won't do anything to combat climate change.  I believe we can continue to create jobs and grow our economy while taking major steps to protect our land and water and reduce carbon emissions. In Alaska, we have enormous natural resources to develop wind, hydroelectric, and tidal power as a new energy source. Let's take on climate change together: DrAlGrossAK.com

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: From Anchorage to Denali, from Denali to Fairbanks, from Fairbanks to Delta Junction, the last week on the road has been inspiring. All over the state hard-working Alaskans are sick of politicians who serve special interests, and are ready for common sense solutions. Our time on the road continues to encourage me that together, we will win this race. #AlwaysAlaska

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Our campaign to reduce the cost of healthcare and build a new Alaskan economy is gaining momentum every day. So glad to have Joe Paskvan's support as we continue to grow this grassroots campaign for Alaska!  “We have an opportunity to defeat Dan Sullivan in 2020 and send a doctor to Washington who will put the interests of Alaskans first. I visited with Al again in Fairbanks and his understanding of the issues is unparalleled. He’ll stand up for all of us in Washington. I’m committed to his candidacy and am eager to help build the winning coalition we need to win next November.” – Joe Paskvan, Former State Senator

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Thank you to our hosts Ellen Weiser and David Weissman for hosting a great event tonight at their beautiful home in Fairbanks. A great conversation with a breathtaking view of the Tanana River. I can’t wait to represent our amazing state and fight for all of us. #AlwaysAlaska

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: I'm a doctor and I will defend a woman’s right to choose -- and fight attacks on safe, affordable reproductive healthcare. Dan Sullivan and Mitch McConnell won't.   It's time for a new voice in Washington who understands healthcare and stands with women to keep government out of deeply personal medical decisions.   Join me:

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Thrilled to have another leader for the state of Alaska backing our campaign. Thank you so much for your support and friendship, Sara Hannan!   “Just like Al, I’m a lifelong Alaskan. I grew up in Anchorage, lived in Juneau for 32 years, and am committed to supporting candidates who will stand strong for the people of our great state. There’s no doubt that in the U.S. Senate Dr. Al Gross will be a champion for our state. I endorse him and am committed to seeing him elected in November 2020. Now is the time for dedicated problem solvers.” - Sara Hannan, State Representative

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Monica and I are hooking up our Airstream to the back of my Chevy and heading out all over the state to talk to regular Alaskans about why it's time to kick Koch-backed politicians like Senator Dan Sullivan out of office.   And unlike Governor Mike Dunleavy's private "budget roadshows" hosted and paid for by the Koch brothers, you can ask me whatever questions you want, record us talking, and post to whatever social media you'd like.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Governor Dunleavy's budget veto that cuts funding for the University of Alaska by 41% shows why it's more important than ever for our state to elect a different kind of leader next November.  As the father of college students and recent graduates, I know how important a college education can be and how cost-prohibitive higher education is for many Alaskans. We simply cannot afford to lose educated people and those who want to seek a degree in today's economy. I'll be a U.S. Senator who fights to make college more affordable and accessible for all Alaskans.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: This is a big day for our campaign -- and a special endorsement from a great friend, former First Lady of Alaska, Bella Hammond. Thank you for your support, and your friendship, Bella!  y support his candidacy.” – Bella Hammond, Former First Lady of Alaska

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: With Dunleavy attacking Alaska’s Supreme Court and a woman’s right to choose, it’s never mattered more to send a doctor to Washington who will fight for a woman’s right to make her own medical decisions in consultation with her doctor. I’m proud to be pro-choice.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: “Alaskans have a choice to make: do we follow the road that leads to universities being underfunded and seniors left on the side? Or, do we work together to lower the cost of healthcare and invite businesses back into our state? I choose the latter, which is why I strongly support Dr. Al Gross for United States Senate. His commitment to Alaska is unparalleled and his vision for solutions gives me hope. I’m all in.” - former State Representative Beth Kerttula  Join Beth and back Al Gross for U.S. Senate: DrAlGrossAK.com

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Senator Dan Sullivan votes with his party 97% of the time, but he hasn't said a word about whether he supports the Dunleavy-Koch budget cuts that would gut the University of Alaska system, decimate Medicaid, and eliminate Alaska's senior benefit program.  Where’s Dan Sullivan? Alaskans deserve to know. Ask him now: http://bit.ly/30ns9o8

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: The Anchorage Daily News is reporting that Governor Mike Dunleavy's budget vetoes will likely pull Alaska back into a recession. I'm dropping off a letter at Senator Dan Sullivan's office, urging him to use his influence with Alaska Republicans to help override the vetoes. As a doctor, I’ve taken an oath to serve my patients. As a commercial fisherman, I know how to navigate through storms and reach calmer waters. I’ve faced off with multiple grizzly bears. I'm not afraid of reaching across the aisle to fight for Alaska. Read my letter here: https://twitter.com/DrAlGrossAK/status/1148748936460558336

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: I'm honored to receive Senator Johnny Ellis' support for my campaign today. A truly remarkable public servant for Alaska who I am proud to call my friend.  “As we are rallying to save our state from extremist policies, Dr. Al gives me hope. His vision for healthcare and our economy will cut through Ohio Dan’s special interest campaign and lead us to victory in 2020. I am proud to support Dr. Al’s candidacy for the United States Senate and expect to see him sworn in on the senate floor in 2021. I’m all in for Dr. Al.” - Senator Johnny Ellis

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: The governor’s arbitrary cuts to our state budget, including a 41% cut to the University of Alaska, are putting our state on a path to failure that will take generations to recover from. We can’t let partisanship and political games jeopardize Alaska’s future.  Please, contact your legislators and tell them to override Governor Dunleavy’s cuts. Find your legislator here: http://www.elections.alaska.gov/Core/electedofficials.php

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: The debate on #ClimateChange is over, and we can’t continue to allow leaders to run away from this issue. It’s time for us to find real solutions to a problem that's impacting our food, our land, our economy and our security.  It shouldn’t take years of rapidly changing weather patterns, food shortages, and wildfires that destroy lives to convince our elected officials to take action. #AlwaysAlaska

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Wow, the support since we launched this campaign just a few days ago has been truly unbelievable. In 24 hours, we raised more than $150,000 dollars from folks chipping in what they could to help make sure we have the resources we need to take on Dan Sullivan, Mitch McConnell and their dark money donors.  Thank you so much for getting onboard this campaign. Now, we need to keep this momentum going so we’re ready for the attacks we know will be coming our way. Chip in to say you’re ready to take on Mitch McConnell and Dan Sullivan in this fight for our priorities >> http://bit.ly/2XrkFid

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Monica and I had a great time watching the fireworks in Seward last night and cheering the runners conquering Mt. Marathon today.  Happy Birthday America!

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: It’s official, Dr. Al Gross is running for U.S. Senate to take Alaska North to the Future! We need to get this campaign up and running from day one so that we can take on Dan Sullivan and the special interests who will stop at nothing to keep Mitch McConnell’s majority.  Get onboard with Al -- chip in today >> http://bit.ly/2XmVxcq

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Commercial fisherman → orthopedic doctor → husband and father of four → life-long Alaskan. If you're ready for a different kind of leader who'll find solutions that put Alaska first, join our campaign today >> http://bit.ly/2J6gUL3

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Dr. Al Gross is the different kind of candidate we need to defeat Dan Sullivan and dethrone Mitch McConnell. ✅Commercial fisherman ✅A doctor who knows how to make healthcare affordable ✅Took on a grizzly bear in self-defense -- and won ✅Will #EndCitizensUnited & protect women's rights With everything going on in our state right now, it’s clear that politics as usual isn’t working for Alaskans, and that’s why we need a problem solver like Al who will put us first. Get onboard with Al -- chip in today: http://bit.ly/2XIMXsL

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Thank you PBS Kids for creating the first nationally distributed children’s series to feature an Alaska Native lead character! What a great way to engage all kids with the culture and traditions of Alaska Natives. Tune in July 15th for the first episode!

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: I’m at the top of the world for the Nalukataq Whaling Festival! Super friendly whaling captains, their crews, and all the great sharing people of Uqtiagvik.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: A special thank you to Julie Smyth for hosting a potluck that allowed great conversation!  I look forward to returning to Fairbanks soon to continue the discussions and supporting the students across the state earning degrees at the University of Alaska.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate,Ray Troll
text: Good morning! Here’s a fun song from the Ratfish Wranglers out of KetchikanHere's a musical comment on the Pebble Mine written by Russell Wodehouse and I, and performed by the Ratfish Wranglers. Shauna L. Lee is on backing vocals with incendiary lead guitar by special guest Aren Jenkins. Patrick Troll put the video together....

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Ran into Pete Kaiser, winner of last year’s Iditarod. Thanks for stopping work to talk with me, Pete!

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate,Coffee & Quaq
text: "The reality is that many women in AK have to survive something far more dangerous than anything they might encounter in the wild: the men they interact with every day...statistically, the state is even more dangerous for AK Natives, many of whom live in small villages..."

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: I’ve been meeting people across Alaska for the last month. That isn’t easy - many Alaskan towns, like Bethel, are spread out. Thank you to everyone who has picked me up in their car, let me hop in their small plane, or walked with me to their neighbor’s fish camp. I’ll continue visiting my fellow Alaskans off the road system - and hopefully I’ll make it to a front door near you!

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Thank you to Hal and Lynn Spence for opening their home to us for a meet and greet! It was a great conversation with very thoughtful questions.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: We had a great Solstice yesterday in Nikiski talking to voters. Happy Solstice!

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Monica and I had a great afternoon at Glacier Valley Farm learning about Alaska's agriculture industry. Local Alaskan farms are small businesses that are an important growing sector of our state’s economy. It was a stunning Alaskan day and it seemed like we could see the Yensis sweet onions growing in real time.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: I’ll be on the Kenai Peninsula this week. If you’re in Kenai or Soldotna, please consider joining me for this Meet and Greet—I look forward to meeting you.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: My Dad Av helped me learn to steer a boat - one of many important life skills he taught me over the years growing up in Southeast, Alaska.  Just like him, I've taught my kids in turn to have a strong work ethic, humility and know the importance of family.   With that in mind, I'd like to wish all the Dads out there a very Happy Father's Day!

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Do you have friends or family in these communities across Alaska?  Tag them in the comments below to help us spread the word about my listening tour.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: I'd like to give a big thank you to Norman Van Vactor for being my host this week in Bristol Bay. Norman introduced me to many community members.  We also flew to several villages surrounding Dillingham. There I met tribal leaders, learned about rural Alaska's energy issues and discussed the importance of subsistence fishing and hunting.  The weather was great all week, but the mosquitoes were THICK!

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Haven’t had a chance to meet me yet? I’ll be coming to you over the next two weeks of June to learn about your communities and listen to your concerns. Check the schedule for the dates I’ll be in your area.  algrossak.com/listening-tour

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: “The gold and copper at the Pebble site can remain tucked away, but our salmon are already subjected to major challenges with our changing climate. I believe we should put the health of this priceless fishery first, rather than adding the additional challenge of a large mining district just upstream. In this case the fish should, and must come first.” - Dr. Al Gross https://www.adn.com/opinions/2019/06/12/fish-should-come-first-in-bristol-bay/

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: I had a great time at FishExpo 2019 in Naknek. I had the opportunity to talk with many fishermen and fisherwomen as they gear up for the commercial season in Bristol Bay.  You can feel the excitement in the air. Last minute preparations. The sockeye are on their way!

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: My listening tour across Alaska is still underway!  This week, I’ll be in the Bristol Bay Region. Want to stay up to date with news on the exploratory committee and receive email updates?  Fill out the form at the bottom of this webpage: algrossak.com

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Thank you to Linda Behnken and the rest of the ALFA crew for hosting such a nice reception at Halibut Point in Sitka for the North Pacific Fisheries Management Council meeting where salmon bycatch was a hot topic. Delicious crab, black cod, ling cod and more!

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Had a great dinner in Petersburg with concerned veterans about education, healthcare, and job opportunities. Thank you for your service!

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Had a fun day with Monica walking around Pt. Baker and Port Protection knocking on doors and meeting a lot of great rural Alaskans.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Listening to the people of Myers Chuck. Thank you Dan and Carol for hosting!

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Listening to the elders at the senior center in Metlakatla, the only reservation in Alaska.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Big congrats to Unite HERE Local 878 - Alaska.  This is a big win for worker’s rights, better wages, and safer working conditions! #unionstrong

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: I had a really fun tour of the Hollis School by a bunch of great kids and teachers today and got to meet and introduce myself at the Prince of Wales Community Advisory Council monthly meeting too! And I started the day at 6 by driving 2 hrs to Kasaan to meet w tribal leaders there. Beautiful day🙂

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Alaska has the highest unemployment rate in the entire country and we have the highest healthcare prices in the world!  These two stats are completely intertwined.  We absolutely have to fix healthcare if we are going to promote new growth and new jobs for this state and get out of this prolonged recession.  Too many people are leaving.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: As we prepare to join our friends and families for a cook out or a party on Memorial Day, I hope everyone will take a minute to chip in $3 or $25 or however much you can to the Wounded Warrior Project, which works so hard to take care of those who sign up to make the ultimate sacrifice to protect our way of life. WWP has lined up some generous donors to match your contribution today, so double your impact by giving on Memorial Day: https://support.woundedwarriorproject.org/default.aspx?tsid=10201&ovr_acv_id=6518&campaignSource=ONLINE&source=BS19026&gclsrc=aw.ds&&gclid=EAIaIQobChMI68Od5M-84gIVibfsCh1NKA1HEAAYASAAEgKHw_D_BwE&gclsrc=aw.ds

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: "The decision whether or not to bear a child is central to a woman's life, to her well-being and dignity. It is a decision she must make for herself. When Government controls that decision for her, she is being treated as less than a fully adult human responsible for her own choices."

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: It’s been great listening to the people of Ketchikan this weekend. One thing I keep hearing is that they want someone who will stand up for Alaska, even if that means standing up against party bosses. Whether it’s on health care or Pebble mine or the marine highway system, I keep hearing that we need someone who will fight for what’s best for Alaska.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: I’m officially exploring a run for Senate because I think we deserve better than someone who thinks he knows what a woman should do with her body better than she does, better than someone who would strip away health care from thousands of hard working Alaskans because his political bosses in DC told him to, better than someone who refuses to speak out against Pebble Mine while quietly raking in huge donations from corporate special interests. I’m exploring this run because I think we deserve a Senator who puts Alaska first.  Add your name if you agree. https://www.algrossak.com

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Thank you Representative Ivy Spohnholz for standing up for women's rights! It's wrong for the government to tell us what to do with our bodies; that's not what our government is supposed to be doing. As a doctor, I know that difficult health care decisions, including abortion, should be between the patient and his or her health care provider, and should not be dictated by our government.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: It was great getting a chance to talk to folks in Coffman and Thorne Bay over the last couple days, but one thing I kept hearing from people was that there aren’t nearly enough jobs, and many had no health insurance. As a doctor and a fisherman, I understand both the needs and potential of communities like these, and if I decide to run for Senate, I will bring their voices to DC.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Pulling into Wrangell now! Looking forward to chatting with you about what’s on the top of your minds, challenges your community is facing, and how you feel like you can be better represented in DC.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Thank you for all the good wishes and support! Our listening tour has officially started. Please visit algrossak.com to find out when I'll be in your community, and when we can find time to talk. If you don't see your town, I'm always up for a phone call.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Right now, in Petersburg! You're welcome to fly, boat, or walk over and join. Whatever's easiest! #petersburg #al4ak #alaska

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Local news keeps us honest! Thanks for the interview, Joe.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Hey Petersburg!  Join us today at 5 p.m. in the Salty Pantry parking lot for a very special announcement - plus music, snacks, and a generally good time. Can't wait to see you there.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Went out for a ride on the boat this evening with my mom. If you’re in Petersburg, join us tomorrow night at 5 pm at the Salty Pantry! I’m excited to launch this journey together!

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: In Alaska, a listening tour takes a plane, car, and gillnetter. Looking forward to it - see you there!

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: There's no spot on a traditional resume for "Monica and I balanced both our medical careers plus commercial fishing while raising four Alaskans," but it's definitely up there for me in terms of accomplishments.

source: Dr. Al Gross for US Senate
text: Dad, husband, commercial fisherman, surgeon, business owner, teacher, health care policy advocate, and life-long Alaskan.
